alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 08 at 4:01PM AKST until March 10 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations 3 to 6 inches. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Winds gusting to 40 mph. * WHERE...Southeastern Brooks Range. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Large snow drifts will form. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will develop this afternoon with south winds 15 to 25 mph in passes. Winds will turn north and increase to 25 mph gusting to 40 mph late tonight causing low visibility in blowing snow. These strong north winds and blowing snow will continue into early Friday. Winds and blowing snow are expected to diminish Friday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
